document:
Header:
KONGU ENGINEERING COLLEGE, PERUNDURAI, ERODE - 638 060 (Autonomous)
Ref: KEC/PLN/TA/DA NORMS-Functions/25-26/1
Date: December 17, 2025

NOTE
Sub: Revised norms for expenses towards Association Inaugural and Valedictory Function, National Level Technical Symposium, Inter / Intra Department events, Guest lecture/ partial delivery of course by industrial experts, National Conference / International Conference, Value Added Course, One Credit Course /International Certification Course, Self-Supporting Course through IIPC, Sponsored Seminar / Workshop / Conference – Reg.

1. Association Inaugural and Valedictory Function

Recommended Remuneration and other Expenses:
1. Honorarium to Resource Persons, Memento & TA:
   i. Physical mode: Maximum of Rs. 5,000/- for FN/AN session (or) Rs.7500/- for full day + TA as per actual incurrence. (For Own Car Rs.10/- km)
   ii. Online mode: Rs. 2000 to 3000/- per 2 hrs session (Depending on the level of expertise)
2. Refreshment: Rs.30/- per head
3. Certificate: Rs.25/- per certificate
4. Refreshment for guests: Rs.750/-
5. Stage arrangement, banner or thermocoal sheet letter cuttings: Rs.2000/-
6. Reception items: Rs.1000/-
7. Miscellaneous: Rs.2000/-

Note:
1. If the honorarium is not accepted by the resource person, a memento worth maximum of Rs.5000/- may be given or the sanctioned amount towards honorarium should be refunded.
2. If the resource person provides his honorarium for student's activity, the amount can be given as prize money.

metadata.doc_title: Revised Norms for Expenses - Kongu Engineering College

document:
2. National Level Technical Symposium

Recommended remuneration and Other Expenses:
1. Chief Guest Honorarium, Memento & TA:
   i. Physical mode: Maximum of Rs. 5,000/- for FN/AN session (or) Rs.7500/- for full day + TA as per actual incurrence. (For Own Car Rs.10/- km)
   ii. Online mode: Rs.2000 – 3000/- per 2 hrs session (Depending on the level of expertise)
2. Maximum size of Banner (12'x10'): Rs.3,000/-
3. Delegate Kit: Rs.200/- per delegate
4. Memento for Chairpersons: Rs.500/- per chairperson
5. Prizes for external participants: Rs.30,000/-
6. Lunch: Rs.100/- per head
7. Miscellaneous (includes Rangoli, Reception, Photo etc.): Rs.4,000/-
8. Refreshment for Participants, Students, Faculty and Staff: Rs.30/- Per head per session

Note:
1. If the honorarium is not accepted by the resource person, a memento worth maximum of Rs. 5000/- may be given or the sanctioned amount towards honorarium should be refunded.
2. If the resource person provides his honorarium for student's activity, the amount can be given as prize money.

metadata.doc_title: Revised Norms for Expenses - Kongu Engineering College

document:
Note for organizing National Level Technical Symposium:
1. No. of days is limited to one day
2. No internal participants for any event
3. Should not organize cultural programs
4. Refreshment must be limited upto Rs.60/- per head for 2 sessions of a day
5. Lunch should be arranged only for the participants in Food court or Hostel at a maximum cost of Rs.100/- per head. The HOD concerned must approve the menu.
6. Advertisement banner / display board for the symposium should be limited to two and the maximum size is allowed upto 12'x10'
7. Backdrop decoration in the seminar hall is not permitted; instead, one banner may be fixed in the backdrop
8. Stickers and handouts for the publicity of the symposium are not permitted
9. Sponsorship from any company / firm towards the association expense should be avoided
10. Showcase models should not be displayed
11. Money should not be collected from the students for purchasing T-Shirt, decoration etc. Violation of which will be viewed seriously
12. Any program in continuation of the symposium should not be conducted
13. Internal faculty members should alone be called as chairpersons for technical sessions.
14. A maximum of 8 events are allowed (Technical workshops: Max. 2 can be included)

metadata.doc_title: Revised Norms for Expenses - Kongu Engineering College

document:
3. Inter / Intra Department events (Association Activities)
1. Banner should be limited to one and maximum size allowed is 10'x6'
2. No. of days limited to one day
3. Two events per year are permitted
4. Only internal faculty members should be called as chairpersons for technical sessions and the Memento for chairperson is limited upto Rs.500/- per head
5. No Common Lunch
6. Certificate: Rs.25/- per certificate
7. Miscellaneous: Rs.2000/-

4. Guest Lecture (Association Activities)
1. Honorarium to Resource Person:
   i. Physical mode – limited to Rs.5,000/- for FN/AN session(or) Rs.7500/- for full day + TA as per actual incurrence (For Own Car Rs.10/- per km)
   ii. Online mode – Rs.2000 – 3000/- per 2hrs session (Depending on the level of expertise)
2. No refreshment for students and internal faculty
3. Refreshment for guests is limited upto Rs.750/-
4. Miscellaneous expenses upto Rs. 750/-
Note: If honorarium not accepted, memento max Rs. 5000/- allowed.

5. Adjunct faculty / Partial delivery of appropriate course by industrial experts (Norms as per AICTE guidelines)
1. Honorarium to Resource Person: Rs. 1000/- per lecture hour upto a maximum of Rs.4000/- per day of service + TA as per actual incurrence (For Own Car Rs.10/- per km)

metadata.doc_title: Revised Norms for Expenses - Kongu Engineering College

document:
5. Adjunct faculty / Partial delivery (Continued)
2. Minimum no. of hours to be taught: 50 hrs per year (2 consecutive semesters)
3. No refreshment for students and internal faculty
4. Refreshment for guests limited upto Rs.750/-
5. Miscellaneous expenses upto Rs. 750/-

Note:
1. QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:
   i. Adjunct Faculty: Retired faculty or person of eminence with 10-15 years industry experience.
   ii. Industrial expert: 10 to 15 years experience.
2. HODs must get annual approval from Principal and Correspondent.
3. If honorarium provided for student activity, can be used as prize money.

metadata.doc_title: Revised Norms for Expenses - Kongu Engineering College

document:
6. National Conference/ International Conference

Recommended Remuneration and other Expenses (National | International):
1. Chief Guest Honorarium:
   - National: Max Rs. 5,000 (FN/AN) or Rs.7500 (Full day) + TA. Online: Rs.2000–3000.
   - International: As Actuals. Online: Rs.3000–5000.
2. Banner (3 Nos.): Rs.6,000/- | Rs.7,500/-
3. Brochure: Rs.3750/- (75 Nos) | Rs.7000/- (100 Nos). E-Flyer design: Rs.500/page.
4. Covering Letter/Postage: Rs.1500/- | Rs.3000/-
5. Author Kit: Rs.500/- per delegate | Rs.1000/- per delegate
6. Internal Chairperson Honorarium: Rs.500/- | Rs.1000/-
7. External Chairperson Honorarium: -- | Rs. 3,000/- per session + TA
8. Breakfast: Rs.75/- | Rs. 100/-
9. Lunch: Rs.125/- | Rs.150/-
10. Dinner: Rs. 75/- | Rs. 100/-
11. Special Dinner: -- | Rs.300/-
12. Reception/Decor: Rs.3,000/- | Rs.5,000/-
13. Refreshment: Rs.30 | Rs.40
14. Proceedings: Rs. 6,000/- | Rs. 60,000/- (ISBN)
15. Certificates: Rs. 25/- | Rs. 25/-
16. Cultural Expenses: -- | Rs. 15,000/-
17. Photo/Video/Marketing: Rs. 5,000/- | Rs. 10,000/-
18. Miscellaneous: Rs. 3,000/- | Rs. 10,000/-

metadata.doc_title: Revised Norms for Expenses - Kongu Engineering College

document:
Notes for National/International Conference:
i. Memento max Rs.5000/- if honorarium not accepted.
ii. TA for guest speakers needs separate approval.
iii. If sponsored, funding agency norms apply.
iv. Additional charges can be collected for journal publication.

7. Value Added Courses
1. Co-ordinator's fee: Nil
2. Faculty Remuneration: Theory Rs.750/- hr; Practical Rs.300/- hr per faculty
3. Non-Teaching Staff Remuneration: Rs.500 per day (holiday); Rs.250 per day (after hours)
4. Certificate: Rs.20/-
5. Refreshment: Rs.25/- per participant
6. Course material: e-content
7. Miscellaneous: Rs.1,500/-
Note:
i. Min registrations: 30 (30 hrs) & 35 (45 hrs)
ii. Fees remittance within 5 days.
iii. Fee structure: 30 hrs - Rs.1300/-; 45 hrs - Rs.2000/-
iv. Floated between 1st to 4th sem only.

metadata.doc_title: Revised Norms for Expenses - Kongu Engineering College

document:
8. One credit Courses / International certification courses

1. Industrial experts (Physical Mode): Rs.5000 - 10000/- (inclusive of TA & DA) + GST/TDS per day depending on expertise (min 6 Hours).
2. Faculty Remuneration (for mixed mode): Theory Rs.700/- hr; Practical Rs.350/- hr.
3. Co-ordination fee (Fully industrial expert mode): Rs.1500/-
4. Non-Teaching Staff: Rs.200/- (Working Sat); Rs.500/- (Holiday).
5. Refreshment: Rs.25/-
6. Miscellaneous: Rs.1,500/-

Note:
1. Min students: 20
2. Course fee (30 hrs): Rs.1500 - 2500/-.
3. Floated 1st to 7th sem during holidays/vacation.
4. Internal faculty assisting single industrial expert: Rs.250/- per hour.
5. International certification fees borne by students.
6. Accommodation for experts on payable basis.
7. Remaining amount reimbursed to participants.

metadata.doc_title: Revised Norms for Expenses - Kongu Engineering College

document:
9. Field visit
1. Max distance: 100 kms
2. Transport: College Bus (Free)
3. Max passengers: 60
4. Time: 9:00 am to 4:00 pm
5. Toll, parking, lunch for driver: As actuals
Note: Approval 3 days prior. Max 3 courses per industry.

10. Self-supporting courses: FDP/Workshops/ courses through IIPC (External participants)
1. Co-ordinator's fee: 10% of registration fee
2. Faculty Remuneration: Theory Rs.750/- hr; Practical Rs.300/- hr
3. Non-Teaching Staff: Rs. 250/- (normal day); Rs.500/- (holiday)
4. Overhead Charges: Min 40% of fee paid to college
5. Lunch: Rs.125/- per head/day
6. Certificate: Rs.20/-

metadata.doc_title: Revised Norms for Expenses - Kongu Engineering College

document:
10. Self-supporting courses (Continued)
7. Refreshment: Rs.30/-
8. Kit/Material: Rs.100/-
9. Brochure: e-Flyer
10. Miscellaneous: Rs.2,000/-
Note:
1. Min students: 20 (Faculty) / 50 (Students).
2. Min Fee (inclusive GST): External faculty Rs. 1,500/-; Students Rs.1000/-.
3. Course coordinator decides expenses for mixed participants based on overheads.

metadata.doc_title: Revised Norms for Expenses - Kongu Engineering College

document:
11. Sponsored Seminar / Workshop / Conference/ FDP/ STTP

1. Co-ordinator Fee: Rs. 2,000/- (Up to 2 days); Rs.2000 + Rs.750/addl day (Above 2 days)
2. Honorarium to Resource Persons: Physical Max Rs. 5,000 (FN/AN) or Rs.7500 (Full day). Online Rs.2000–3000.
3. Remuneration for internal faculty: Rs. 2,500/- per session (min 1.5 hrs)
4. Banner: Rs. 2,500/-
5. Brochure & Postal: Rs.750/- each
6. Kit: Rs.250/- (<=2 days); Rs.500/- (>2 days)
7. Refreshment: Rs.30/- per session
8. Lunch: Rs.125/- per person
9. Food for guest speakers: Rs. 1,500/- per day
10. Certificates: Rs.25/-
11. Miscellaneous: Rs.2,500/-
12. Overhead Charges: Minimum 20% of sponsored amount and registration fee.

Note:
1. Funding agency norms take precedence if specified.
2. Memento max Rs.5,000/- if honorarium rejected.

metadata.doc_title: Revised Norms for Expenses - Kongu Engineering College

document:
12. All Clubs, Cells and Student Chapters should follow the relevant norms.
13. Programmes which are not covered under the above categories will be considered as special programmes and separate approval may be obtained based on the need.

(Signed) Planning Cell, Principal, Correspondent, Secretary.
